intro: Jacquinotia prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate jacquinotia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a low-growing shrub that typically reaches a height of only a few centimeters. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture. Jacquinotia prostrata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
